intro: Ecbolium microstachyum, commonly known as the small-stalked ecbolium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture. Ecbolium microstachyum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
